Im also from charkhi dadri.
My mother used to tell me about this incident. When she was about 10-12 years old . She was on the roof and playing with siblings.
Then they all saw something that is burning in the air as they didn't know what is going on around them.
Then my nana ji asked them to go to their room 
And then she also said that all the villagers started following the thing that was burning in the sky
Later they came to know that it was a plane
Everyone was afraid coz they didn't know where it would going to fall.
I can imagine my self in this situation it would be a horrifying moment for the passengers and the citizens

pilots of the Ilyushin Il-76M Combi multi mission heavy lift transport aircraft misinterpreted flight communication from ATC leading to India's worst aviation disaster ever till date . . . ATC operators aircraft ki automated transponder signal se pata kar lete hai ki kaun sa aircraft kahan hai aur kahan ja rahe hain . . . ATC ki radar jab ek aircraft ki transponder signal apne aap (automatic) pakar lete hain tab ATC ko oos aircraft ki heading, altitude aur flight id instantly pata chal jata hai . . . without any prior dialogue with the pilot crew . . . lekin yeh transponder signal ki automatic detection tab hi detect ho sakta agar airport mein active radar guidance hai . . . sirf ground radar se yeh kam nahi ho sakte . . .

IGI Airport पर Latest Secondry radar आ चुके थे, but इनस्टॉल नहीं हो पाये थे,

हालांकि ये mid air collision Kazak Air line के pilot की गलती से हुआ था
 
उसको इंग्लिश अच्छे से नहीं आती थी
 Kazak plane पुराने desine का milltry plane था जिसको civel plane मे कन्वर्ट किया गया था
जिसकी बजह से Altitude display मीटर की cokpit  position थोड़ा ऑड थी जिस पर हमेशा pilot की नज़र नहीं रह पाती थी 
Air Traffic कण्ट्रोल ने जिस फ्लाइट लेवल पर उड़ने के लिए बोला था ये  उस altitude पर नहीं उड़ रहा था
हादसे से कुछ second पहले pilot को अपनी गलत Altitude पर उड़ने का एहसास हो गया था, और उसने अपनी position को सही करने के  फ्लाइट mecenism execute कर दीया,   सही करने की  प्रक्रिया के बीच ही टक्कर हो  गई, विमान ATC द्वारा  दीया गया अलटिटूड पर जा रहा था,  पर तब तक पोहचा   नहीं था, अगर हाइट सही करने की प्रक्रिया execute नहीं की  जाती  तो  पहले जहा गलत उड़ रहा तो टक्कर नहीं होती और Plane एक दूसरे के  के ऊपर नीचे से निकाल  जाते
Kazak plane जहा पहले  गलत Altitude पर था  वहां उड़ता रहता तो टक्कर नहीं होती
लेकिन सही हाइट पर लाने की बीच की प्रोसेस मे टक्कर हो गई 
 इस घटना के बाद पूरी दुनिया मे pilots के लिए नये protocol, विमान निर्माता कंपनी के लिए नये टेक्निकल  updates नियम,
और सभी इंटरनेशनल एयरपोर्ट के लिए Latested radar लगाने के लिए  कड़े नियम बनाये गए थे

There is also another very important point about TCAS which was missed here I believe (I am not an aviation expert by any means though). At one point in time, TCAS suggestion to avoid collision to fly up or fly down varied per country and this resulted in a collision between two aircrafts from different countries, also in 90s, as far as I remember. Since then a standard was brought to ensure they use same TCAS responses so as to avoid collision by asking both planes to move in different direction to each other.

RBSE Solutions for Class 9 Physical Education Chapter 6 Health and Environment

January 11, 2022 by Veer Leave a Comment

RBSE Solutions for Class 9 Physical Education Chapter 6 Health and Environment are part of RBSE Solutions for Class 9 Physical Education. Here we have given Rajasthan Board RBSE Class 9 Physical Education Chapter 6 Health and Environment.

ADVERTISEMENT

BoardRBSETextbookSIERT, RajasthanClassClass 9SubjectPhysical EducationChapterChapter 6Chapter NameHealth and EnvironmentNumber of Questions Solved17CategoryRBSE Solutions

Rajasthan Board RBSE Class 9 Physical Education Chapter 6 Health and Environment

TEXTBOOK QUESTIONS SOLVED

Multiple Choice Questions

Question 1.
Pollution leaves its adverse effect on:
(a) Body.
(b) Mind.
(c) Thoughts.
(d) Health.
Answer:
(d).

Question 2.
Health means
(a) Beautiful body.
(b) Beautiful mind.
(c) Cleanliness.
(d) Healthy body, concentration of mind and social security.
Answer:
(d).

Question 3.
3/4th part of the Earth holds
(a) Soil.
(b) Water.
(c) Sunlight.
(d) Pollution.
Answer:
(b).

Question 4.
Felling of the trees should be banned so as to control
(a) Air pollution.
(b) Water pollution.
(c) Noise pollution.
(d) All the above.
Answer:
(a).

Question 5.
Fill in the blanks

Height of the …………….. fitted in the factories should be more than that of the residential accommodation.

Water of the ……………… is best for drinking if it is not heavy and acidic.

Light should reach the students from their ……………. side.

Ventilators let out the and windows let in the …………….. .

Answer:

Chimneys

Hand pump

Left

Carbon dioxide, Oxygen

Short Answer Type Questions

Question 1.
What are the causes of air pollution?
Answer:
Vehicular emissions, Industrialization, Felling of trees, Use of Pesticides, Unhealthy Sanitary conditions.

Question 2.
Write a brief note on rain water storage.
Answer:
Water from the initial two or three rains is polluted due to presence of dust particles in it. After two or three rounds the rain water becomes pure. It was a practice in Rajasthan to collect this water in the tanks to be used for the whole year. This practice of collecting the rain water by different means can solve the problem.

Question 3.
What are the effects of air pollution?
Answer:
Effects of Air Pollution: The polluted air may make man victim of various diseases such as cough, lung cancer, pneumonia, asthma or bronchitis.

Question 4.
Write a brief note on clean toilets.
Answer:
Toilets should be kept neat and clean by getting them washed with disinfectants because dirty toilets become the cause of many infectious diseases.

Question 5.
What are adverse effects of noise pollution.
Answer:
Effects of Noise Pollution:

It can damage heart, increase blood cholesterdl level and blood pressure too.

It dilates the cerebral blood vessels resulting in headache.

Continuous exposure to noise pollution may lead to deafness.

It may cause many physical ailments like growth of ulcer, paralysis, insanity etc.

Mental tension resulting from noise pollution may lead to lack of concentration.

Psychological effects of noise pollution are stomach disorder, reduced hormonal secretions etc.

Noise pollution may develop the habits of intolerance, and stress. As a result, social relations become bitter. ‘

Question 6.
How have Locke and Mary Backer defined health?
Answer:
According to Locke, “Healthy mind can reside only in healthy body”.
In the words of Mary Backer, “National prosperity depends upon the best human beings”.

Question 7.
Which gases are responsible for polluting the air?
Answer:
Various air pollutants are carbon dioxide, carbon monoxide, sulphur dioxide, fluorides, smoke, ozone, hydrogen chloride, ammonia, pollen and microbes, pesticides, oxides of nitrogen, dust, iron-filings etc.

Question 8.
What are the uses of water-sewage system?
Answer:
Water disposal system should be proper and adequate because:

It will remove the human excreta easily.

There will be no need for manual labour.

It is an easy and cheap method.

Mosquitoes and flies may breed over the human excreta.

There are minimum chances of spread of diseases.

Long Answer Type Questions

Question 1.
What does the term health imply?
Answer:
“Health is the state of complete physical fitness and mental well-being and not merely the absence of disease or infirmity”.
Health is related with the healthy community environment. Community is formed of the individuals and an individual is a unit of the society. The society can be healthy only if its members are keeping good health and they live in healthy environment—external and internal. Cleanliness is the best means to promote good health. It is the man who adopts all means to keep the environment clean and he removes all health hazards.

He attempts to keep not only the surroundings clean but also to develop the natural beauty. The environment which includes climate, temperature, social and cultural factors, affects the physical fitness of a person. The interaction between man and his surroundings is very important. The basic aim for man is prevention of diseases through improvement in environments through better housing, better ventilation, pure water supply and removal and disposal of refuse and sewerage system.

Question 2.
What is the significance of health?
Answer:
Health is related with the healthy community environment. Community is formed of the individuals and an individual is a unit of the society. The society can be healthy only if its members are keeping good health and they live in healthy environment—external and internal. Cleanliness is the best means to promote good health. It is the man who adopts all means to keep the environment clean and he removes all health hazards. He attempts to keep not only the surroundings clean but also to develop the natural beauty.

Good environments are useful for personal health. Open air, well ventilated room, greenery and open space lead to better respiration and better digestion. Suffocation, dirt, polluted air etc

Vodka appears like water and has very little aroma or smell to it. Many imbibers like vodka for this very reason.  Vodka also can be drunk neat or on the rocks without the need for mixers or additives. The reason I say this is because of a minor incident on an Aeroflots Tupulov flight from Singapore to Bombay. The plane had a centre galley, fully visible from our seats. We were the crew of  Air India being transhipped to our base. The flight was surprisingly routed through Pnom Penh. After the rudimentary service from Pnom Penh was over, I saw a supernumerary operating crew member pull out a bar box and sit on it in the galley. He had a large paper cup in hand and was sipping from it.  He had a number of refills till we came to Bombay. Before landing, the galley is usually secured but this person continued to sit on the bar box, coolly sipping away, even while the plane landed.. This was once in a lifetime scene where I saw a crew throw caution to the winds. This happened fifty years ago. Strict rules have now been imposed especially on Indian carriers.

The fact that I came to know after watching this video and doing some study  :- TRAFFIC COLLISION ALARMING SYSTEM (TCAS) is one of the best measurements taken in aviation history ever in case to provide safety..  ATC provides a "squak code" (basically a 4 digit code) to the pilots to enter into the "transponder" (as told by Dhruv Sir) located in cockpit. TCAS and the transponder provide the speed and altitude and also the position of the aircrafts to the ATCs. Thanks to Dhruv sir for creating such an informative video that inpspired me to learn a new thing..

ANOTHER MID CRASH WAS ON November 20, 2002, when two passenger planes (Air Deccan and Indian Airlines) collided in mid-air in the state of Andhra Pradesh. All 160 passengers and crew on board the two planes died. Primary RADAR is just one way communication between ASR and Flight.
While Secondary Radar is Two way communication between ASR and Flight.

DVOR and DME are radar which helps in landing flight to airports which givers distance and Height of flight.

You missed some information, 

The Kazakhstan flight's radio officer did not tell the pilots about the altitude to maintain, if he had said them, this would have been avoided 

2. The radio officer said the pilots to maintain 15000 feet when they were already at 14000 feet, so when he said the pilots to climb to 15000 feet, they initiated their climb and then collided with the saudi plane. 
If they had continued the descent, then they would have passed the saudi plane by flying below them 👍

I would like to make just a small correction. 16:40 The information about there being no mid air collision after this incident is incorrect. There were a few mid air collisions. The deadliest amongst those was on Sept 29 2006 which happened between the flights Gol Transportes Aéreos Flight 1907 / ExcelAire flight, killing all 154 passengers and crew on the boeing 737. The other aircraft managed to land miraculously

TCAS - collision warning system was present in the Russian flight which gave out a warning to pull up the plane before collision. But there was so much confusion and communication gap in the cabin that , the pilot overriding the warning decided to pull down instead of pulling up which caused this disaster.
In Delhi airport there was one single air corridor that is a fact, it was because the rest of the air corridors in Delhi airport was used by Indian Air force where commercial flights were not allowed.
After the accident dedicated air corridors for incoming and outgoing flights were made in Delhi.

*On 12 November 1996, Saudia Flight 763, a Boeing 747 en route from Delhi, India, to Dhahran, Saudi Arabia, and Kazakhstan Airlines Flight 1907, an Ilyushin Il-76 en route from Chimkent, Kazakhstan, to Delhi, collided over the village of Charkhi Dadri, around 100 km (62 mi; 54 nmi) west of Delhi.The crash killed all 349 people on board both planes, making it the world's deadliest mid-air collision and the deadliest aviation accident to occur in India* .
